discourse_list.title: Governance house is becoming part of the Llama!

content.content: Great news, we have merged with Llama, which means that we will have a support of a strong and active community with expertise in Web3 and DeFi. Llama works with DAOs on protocol engineering, treasury allocation, and analytics. Llama’s goal is to help decentralized communities maximize their impact. They work with Aave, Uniswap, Nouns, dYdX, Gitcoin, Radicle, PoolTogether, FWB, Harvest Finance, Tribe DAO, and more. They have implemented protocol upgrades, designed treasury strategies, and liquidity incentive programs, and built analytics dashboards and financial reports.  Our Values are aligned At Llama and Governance House we believe in being open, building trust through collaboration and realizing possibilities together as a team. Our values shape how we act with each other, our partners and help us to achieve our vision of helping communities realize their full potential. Our foundational beliefs, reflect our values:  Rigor. Work done by Llama is of the highest quality. We care deeply about getting the details right in anything we do: smart contracts, governance forum posts, or analytics dashboards. Ownership. We treat the problems of the DAOs we work with as if they were our own. There is little to no separation between Llama and the DAOs we work with. Trust. We seek to actively earn the trust of the DAOs we work with. We involve the community in our work and incorporate feedback where relevant. Transparency. We believe in open lines of communication and are comfortable working in a DAO-native manner.   New Extended Core Team We are a team of experts, each with a differing degree of expertise. Our team has solidity engineers, DeFi strategists, data scientists, financial analysts, and chartered accountants. These core team members are integrated well across DeFi and have high context with regards to the ecosystem. To highlight some of our key members: Puncar (Jan Brezina) 7+ years of experience in financial services innovation and blockchain. Co-founder of Bankless Consulting, core contributor at Llama and Gitcoin. And working closely with other organizations to foster collaboration. Joe King Crypto class of 2016, long time trader and DeFi degen. Spend most of my time doing research and writing about DeFi, Tokenomics, and financial analysis. Day job is freelancing in the catastrophic insurance industry. Matthew Graham Mechanical Engineer with 12+ years of industry experience, bachelor degrees in Mechanical Engineering, Investment Finance and Corporate Finance. Published numerous ARCs with a good understanding of DeFi legos, risks, governance, value flow (tokenomics) and fund management. Austin Green Co-founder of Llama, solidity engineer, previously senior software engineer at Chainalysis. Deployed smart contracts via Aave governance. Shreyas Hariharan Co-founder of Llama, lead at Aave Grants, worked on treasury strategies for Aave, Uniswap, and Gitcoin.  More possibilities on how to help MakerDAO With extended capabilities, we can assist Maker in many new areas, such as financial and treasury reporting, developing a new strategy, developing new integrations with other protocols, reviewing technical proposals, and providing assessments. And that just a few examples, If you want to see what we have done previously at other protocols, please check Community Work | Llama  From now, we are Llama! cc: @Recognized-Delegates
content.GPT-summary: Governance House has merged with Llama, a community with expertise in Web3 and DeFi. Llama works with DAOs on protocol engineering, treasury allocation, and analytics. The post highlights Llama's values and extended core team, and mentions how they can assist MakerDAO in various areas. The post is advertising the merger and the capabilities of Llama, and is extending the proposal to collaborate with MakerDAO. The post is entirely positive and does not ask for feedback or give constructive criticism.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: From GovAlpha’s perspective, we were asked whether a name change was appropriate in this instance or whether a new delegate contract would be required. We have been assured that the Delegate Platform will remain the same, with more support from the Llama team and a name change rather than a diversion from the previously posted platform. Consequently, GovAlpha felt it appropriate to allow a name change in this instance rather than requesting a new platform be created - we feel this is consistent with similar previous decisions. If anyone has any questions feel free to reach out to me or @prose11. Also @Artem_Gordon Puncar has asked if this can be included in any forthcoming announcements so people are aware of the new name.
This is exciting news! I’ll make sure to help spread awareness on the next Weekly Relay.
